metadata.title: CVE-2021-47591 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mptcp:remove tcp ulp setsockopt support TCP_ULP setsockopt cannot be used formptcp because its already used internally to plumb subflow (tcp) sockets tothe mptcp layer. syzbot managed to trigger a crash for mptcp connectionsthat are in fallback mode: KASAN: null-ptr-deref in range[0x0000000000000020-0x0000000000000027] CPU: 1 PID: 1083 Comm:syz-executor.3 Not tainted 5.16.0-rc2-syzkaller #0 RIP:0010:tls_build_proto net/tls/tls_main.c:776 [inline] [..] __tcp_set_ulpnet/ipv4/tcp_ulp.c:139 [inline] tcp_set_ulp+0x428/0x4c0net/ipv4/tcp_ulp.c:160 do_tcp_setsockopt+0x455/0x37c0 net/ipv4/tcp.c:3391mptcp_setsockopt+0x1b47/0x2400 net/mptcp/sockopt.c:638 Remove support forTCP_ULP setsockopt.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
